text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby and leaves for work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator down to the lobby every morning and then takes the elevator again to the 7th floor when he comes back from work, but on rainy days, he goes all the way to the 10th floor.
Hmm, that's a bit confusing at first glance.
Let me break it down step by step.
First, he lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby, which is probably the ground floor, so that's the 1st floor.
Then he leaves for work.
So, he's going from 10th to 1st floor by elevator.
That makes sense because taking the elevator down is faster than walking down the stairs, especially if the building is tall.
Now, in the evening, when he returns from work, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
Wait, why wouldn't he just take the elevator all the way up? Maybe the elevator doesn't go to the 10th floor in the evening, or perhaps it's too slow or something.
But the problem says that on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
So, there's something about rainy days that changes his behavior.
I'm thinking that maybe the elevator has different routes depending on the time of day or the weather.
Perhaps in the morning, the elevator goes from higher floors down to the lobby, but in the evening, it might not go all the way up.
Or maybe the elevator is only going one way during certain times.
Alternatively, maybe the man has a reason related to the elevator's operation, like it's only going down in the morning or something.
Wait, but on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
So, normally, he takes it to the 7th floor and walks up.
But on rainy days, he doesn't walk; he takes the elevator all the way.
That suggests that on rainy days, the elevator is more convenient for him to go up to the 10th floor, maybe because he doesn't want to get wet walking up the stairs.
So, putting it together: every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby because it's faster than walking.

In the evening, when it's not raining, he takes the elevator partway up to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs because maybe the elevator doesn't go all the way up, or it's too slow, or he doesn't mind the walk when it's not raining.
But on rainy days, he prefers to take the elevator all the way up because walking up the stairs would be messy or time-consuming, and the elevator is more efficient.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator's timing is such that it goes up only during certain times or only certain days.
Or perhaps the man has a routine where he avoids taking the elevator up during non-rainy days to save time or for some other reason.
Wait, another angle: maybe the elevator only goes down in the morning and up in the evening, but on rainy days, it goes both ways.
No, that doesn't quite fit because he takes it down in the morning regardless.
Hmm, I think the key is that on rainy days, he doesn't want to walk up the stairs, so he takes the elevator all the way.
On dry days, he takes the elevator partway up to the 7th floor and walks the rest because maybe the elevator isn't as convenient or he prefers the walk when it's not raining.
So, the reason is that on rainy days, he doesn't want to get wet walking up the stairs, so he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
On dry days, he takes the elevator partway and walks the remaining stairs because it's more convenient or perhaps the elevator isn't as efficient for going up on dry days.
I think that makes sense.
So, the main reason is about convenience and avoiding getting wet when it's raining.

</think>

The man takes the elevator down to the lobby in the morning because it's faster.
In the evening, on dry days, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs because the elevator might not go all the way up, or he prefers the walk.
On rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor to avoid getting wet while walking up the stairs.
